gospel.text:
[[Lc 9,51]]When the days for Jesus to be taken up were fulfilled, he resolutely determined to journey to Jerusalem,
[[Lc 9,52]]and he sent messengers ahead of him. On the way they entered a Samaritan village to prepare for his reception there,
[[Lc 9,53]]but they would not welcome him because the destination of his journey was Jerusalem.
[[Lc 9,54]]When the disciples James and John saw this they asked, "Lord, do you want us to call down fire from heaven to consume them?"
[[Lc 9,55]]Jesus turned and rebuked them,
[[Lc 9,56]]and they journeyed to another village.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[Ps 88,2]]LORD, my God, by day I cry out; 
at night I clamour in your presence.
[[Ps 88,3]]Let my prayer come before you; 
incline your ear to my cry.

[[Ps 88,4]]For my soul is filled with troubles; 
my life draws near to Sheol.
[[Ps 88,5]]I am reckoned with those who go down to the pit; 
I am weak, without strength.

[[Ps 88,6]]My couch is among the dead, 
with the slain who lie in the grave. 
Whom you remember no longer
and who are cut off from your care.

[[Ps 88,7]]You plunged me into the bottom of the pit, 
into the darkness of the abyss.
[[Ps 88,8]]Upon me your wrath lies heavy,
and with all your billows you overwhelm me.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Jb 3,1]]Job opened his mouth and cursed his day.
[[Jb 3,2]]Job spoke out and said:
[[Jb 3,3]]Perish the day on which I was born, the night when they said, "The child is a boy!"
[[Jb 3,11]]Why did I not perish at birth, come forth from the womb and expire?
[[Jb 3,12]]Wherefore did the knees receive me? or why did I suck at the breasts?
[[Jb 3,13]]For then I should have lain down and been tranquil; had I slept, I should then have been at rest
[[Jb 3,14]]With kings and counselors of the earth who built where now there are ruins
[[Jb 3,15]]Or with princes who had gold and filled their houses with silver.
[[Jb 3,16]]Or why was I not buried away like an untimely birth, like babes that have never seen the light?
[[Jb 3,17]]There the wicked cease from troubling, there the weary are at rest.
[[Jb 3,20]]Why is light given to the toilers, and life to the bitter in spirit?
[[Jb 3,21]]They wait for death and it comes not; they search for it rather than for hidden treasures,
[[Jb 3,22]]Rejoice in it exultingly, and are glad when they reach the grave:
[[Jb 3,23]]Men whose path is hidden from them, and whom God has hemmed in!
first_reading.title: Book of Job
